channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-13149] Windows distro build fails on dist-copynativelibs.
item.description: HADOOP-12892 pulled the dist-copynativelibs script into an external file. The call to this script is failing when running a distro build on Windows.
item.summary: Windows distro build fails on dist-copynativelibs.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I'm attaching a patch. This is similar to the fix I did for HADOOP-12899.

-1 overall

The -1 is for lack of tests. The patch changes pom.xml only. I verified manually by running the distro build successfully.
Allen, thank you for the review. I committed this to trunk.

FAILURE: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #9767 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/9767/)
HADOOP-13149. Windows distro build fails on dist-copynativelibs. (cnauroth: rev 576e2d1278a584ef8e804832c852c3f8323bb64a)

  • hadoop-project-dist/pom.xml
HADOOP-12892 was backported to branch-2 and branch-2.8, so this commit should be backported as well. What do you think, cnauroth?

ajisakaa, were you able to validate building the distro on Windows for branch-2 and branch-2.8 with this patch? If so, then +1 pending pre-commit. I have reopened the issue and clicked submit patch to get a pre-commit run on the branch-2 patch.
Thanks cnauroth for updating the jira. Now I don't have Windows environment, so it takes some time to prepare the environment using MSDN license.

-1 overall

ajisakaa, that's no problem. I tested it myself, and it appears to partially fix the build. There still seems to be another problem, probably unrelated, in the call to ctest from hadoop-hdfs-native-client. I'll dig into that and try to get a full end-to-end distro build working.

I'd expect that we'd need HADOOP-12899 backported too.
Thanks Chris for testing the patch. Could you give +1 to this? I agreed with you that HADOOP-12899 should be backported as well.

+1. I committed this to branch-2 and branch-2.8. ajisakaa, thank you.

It turns out that we didn't need to bring in HADOOP-12899, because the patch that caused that problem is still only in trunk. We did need to bring in HDFS-10353 though. I'll comment over there.
